data.label:
Narrator

I slouched on my throne, the dim fire casting long shadows. I held an empty glass, lost in thought.

Narrator

However, my moment of solitude was interrupted by the sound of the main throne room doors opening.

Player_Romus

“What are you doing here? I told the guards I wasn't to be disturbed.”

Lucita Azaro

“I apologize, but I had to see you. It's about the investigation into your father's death."

Narrator

Lucita stepped forward.

Lucita Azaro

“We searched his residence and the Golden Guard's headquarters. We found the evidence -- a silver bullet linking him to the crime. This..."

Lucita Azaro

"I found this vial hidden in the Armament Display, within King Henricus Toras' armor. I wasn't sure what it was up until now.”

Narrator

This room, with its heavy curtains and crackling fireplace, offered the respite I craved amidst the relentless tumult of my kingdom's affairs.

Titus Gordion

“I apologize, sir, but I had to see you immediately. It's about the investigation into King Valero's death."

Titus Gordion

“We searched her residence and found the silver bullet clue linking her to the crime. This..."

Titus Gordion

"I found this vial hidden inside a shadow box containing Lucita's military medals and insignia. I didn't know what it was up until now.

Player_Romus

“I knew it! What could have possibly made her do such a thing?”

Lucita Azaro

"You tasked me with investigating a potential connection involving Titus."

Player_Romus

"You must be mistaken. I can confidently say that Duchess Azaro is not capable of murder."

Titus Gordion

"From what I can tell, she saw reclaiming Pales as a means to fulfill her family's aspirations and rectify the perceived injustice of that refusal."

Player_Romus

"To think that my own wife could be the one responsible for such a heinous act. It's like a nightmare I never saw coming."

Player_Romus

"God... I need a drink..."

Narrator

I reached behind the throne and pulled out a bottle of Romus the Red I had strategically hidden, and refilled my glass.

Narrator

I rose from the throne and approached a hidden wall panel, revealing a selection of bottles and glasses.

Titus Gordion

"And may their hearts be warmed by the iron bars of affection."

Titus Gordion

"I understand this is a shock. But sometimes the truth hides in the darkest corners."

Titus Gordion

"Agreed. If she's found guilty of her new charges, should could very well be incarcerated for the rest of her life."

Titus Gordion

"Perhaps it's better to face the truth, no matter how painful. Which is why I'm convinced it stems from your father's refusal to grant General Azaro's plea for another war against Pales. As for Lucita..."

Player_Romus

"I can't believe it... so it is true..."

Lucita Azaro

"Perhaps it's better to face the truth, no matter how painful.”

Lucita Azaro

"Your father never expanded the Golden Guard, nor did he offer Captain Gordion a seat on his council after my father's incapacitation. Perhaps Titus thought you would."

Lucita Azaro

"I had to see you. It's about the investigation into your father's death."

Titus Gordion

"I had to see you, sir. It's regarding the investigation into King Valreo's death."

Lucita Azaro

"Forgive my abruptness, but I had to see you. It concerns the investigation into your father's death."

Titus Gordion

"Forgive my abruptness, sir, but I had to see you. It concerns the investigation into King Valero's death."

Titus Gordion

"I'm sorry, sir. But I'm afraid the evidence says otherwise."

Player_Romus

"I find it hard to believe that after all this time, a small sample of tissue could still provide accurate results."

Titus Gordion

"If you don't believe me, then maybe you'll believe what Duchess Azaro has to say for herself. I sent her an emergency summons."

Titus Gordion

"Funny you should mention it... it just so happens that I took the liberty of inviting Lucita to meet us for that very purpose. She should be arriving shortly."

Player_Romus

"She's coming here now? I wish you'd informed me of this sooner."

Titus Gordion

"While we are waiting, I'd like to bring your attention to another matter."

Titus Gordion

“Speaking of betrayal, there's another a matter I'd like to address."

Titus Gordion

"Government facilities in a handful of smaller municipalities have been seized, sparking street riots as citizens demand change."

Player_Romus

“Well, then what would you call it?”

Player_Romus

“Titus, I think you're blowing this out of proportion.”

Player_Romus

"Your concern is duly noted, Captain. However, I have weathered many storms in my time as king, and I will not falter now."

Titus Gordion

"The ongoing protests we've been seeing have taken a significant turn for the worse, escalating across the entire kingdom."

Titus Gordion

"I've been receiving anonymous tips and warnings from informants within the court and sources outside the kingdom who speak of growing discontent with how Rizia is being led."

Player_Romus

"I won't tolerate betrayal from within my own court. Can you tell me who these traitors are?"

Player_Romus

"Sounds like someone's been reading too many spy thrillers. But in all seriousness, if there's even a hint of truth to these whispers, we must act swiftly."

Player_Romus

"Thanks, but I didn't ask for unsolicited advice."

Player_Romus

"I appreciate your concern, Titus. I'll take it into consideration."

Player_Romus

"Thanks for the weather report, Titus. I'll make sure to pack an umbrella."

Player_Romus

"I see... it seems trust is becoming a rare commodity these days. What else can you tell me?"

Player_Romus

"Anonymous sources... unnamed noble houses... Sorry, but I don't take cryptically vague threats very seriously."

Titus Gordion

“I assure you, this threat is very real. We’re seeing a turning point that we can no longer ignore.”

Player_Romus

"And where do you anticipate this situation is headed?"

Player_Romus

"Damn it! How did things spiral out of control?"

Titus Gordion

"From what I've gathered, my sources hint at potential changes in leadership."

Titus Gordion

"One that might have a significant impact on the information I just disclosed."

Titus Gordion

"I'm sure you're aware of the violent protests against the throne in Cardesse-Montaklar. They are being tolerated if not explicitly condoned by House Azaro."

Titus Gordion

"I'm sure you're aware of the violent protests against the throne in Brenas. They are being tolerated, if not explicitly condoned, by House Sazon."

Titus Gordion

"I'm sure you're aware of the violent protests against the throne in Valenqiris. They are being tolerated, if not explicitly condoned, by the Toras nobles there."

Player_Romus

"You did? Well, well... this should be interesting."

Player_Romus

"God dammit, Titus... I was not prepared for an interrogation."

Player_Romus

"The Azaros have proven to be nothing to but insufferable nuisances. Their house should be burned to the ground -- literally and metaphorically."

Player_Romus

"If that's true, I'm tempted to ensure that the Azaros foot the bill for it rather than the taxpayers."

Titus Gordion

“Speaking of betrayal, there's another matter I'd like to address that warrants your immediate attention."

Player_Romus

"What?! Are you suggesting that the people hold animosity towards me? Surely, you jest..."

Titus Gordion

"We can discuss the how and why all we like, but it doesn't change the trajectory of where this is likely heading..."

Titus Gordion

"For a revolution."

Player_Romus

"A revolution... Never in a million years could I have imagined how how dire things would become. It almost seems laughable."

Titus Gordion

"Unfortunately, all signs point to such a possible outcome."

Player_Romus

"Surely you're not suggesting that I bear responsibility for this."

Player_Romus

"I'm not going anywhere. My place is here. I will face any and all challenges thrown my way head-on."

Titus Gordion

"And then there's the effigies of you that are being burned... Nevertheless, the situation has escalated far beyond calling it mere unrest."

Player_Romus

"After all this time, only now has a murder weapon been discovered?"

Titus Gordion

"I'm glad you've asked. We uncovered this."

Lucita Azaro

"Your Majesty."

Lucita Azaro

"Eyewitness accounts, including my own observations, initially led to suspicion surrounding Hugo's actions on the night of the late King's death."

Titus Gordion

"Mandragora. It's a deadly nightshade known throughout history for inducing hallucinations. However, excessive consumption can lead to fatal consequences."

Lucita Azaro

"Mandragora. It's a deadly nightshade that's been known to induce hallucinations. A large enough dose can result in death."

Titus Gordion

"This here is Mandragora. It's a deadly nightshade known throughout history for inducing hallucinations. Excessive consumption can lead to death."

Narrator

I took a moment to allow the weight of the situation to settle in -- the potential for betrayal within my own nobility.

Player_Romus

"If what you're saying is, you're also implying that Hugo could be involved in such treachery -- perhaps even the orchestrator."

Titus Gordion

"You're proposing a drastic course of action. While removing the main instigator might solve the problem, accusing your uncle of such a grave deed without solid proof could fracture your family irreparably."

Narrator

I took a moment to let the gravity of the situation sink in.

Titus Gordion

"Not to mention, all evidence I've presented points to Lucita. She must be brought to justice. Forgive me for being so blunt, but letting someone else take the fall for her actions would be criminal."

Narrator

I sank more deeply into my seat.

Titus Gordion

"And now that I'm overseeing the Wruhec's Guardians, that responsibility has been bestowed upon them as well."

Lucita Azaro

"But not everyone had a motive."

Player_Romus

"That would certainly track with her actions at the Pales border."

Titus Gordion

"But then you wound up in one anyway."

Titus Gordion

"I suspect she was trying to goad you into one behind the scenes."

Player_Romus

"It's still speculation. After all this time, I want hard facts."

Titus Gordion

"Especially in conjunction with the behavior that landed her in prison."

Titus Gordion

"Agreed. If she's found guilty of her new charges, execution could be warranted."

Titus Gordion

"I will remind you that she has already been found guilty of treason."

Lucita Azaro

"But you can ask him yourself. I've sent him a summons."

Lucita Azaro

"As you know, It all started with eyewitness accounts, placing Hugo exiting your father's private chambers just before his death."

Lucita Azaro

"There was no evidence indicating your uncle's desire to claim the throne. The rumored rivalry was simply a fabrication."

Player_Romus

"Wait. Murder weapon? What murder weapon? This is news to me."

Lucita Azaro

"When the late king was exhumed, a preserved sample of formalin-fixed tissue allowed for an advanced toxicology examination by Iza University's laboratories."

Player_Romus

"You're telling me that after all this time, only now has a murder weapon been discovered?"

Narrator

She paused, as if deliberating whether to tell me something.

Player_Romus

"Valero had to die so that our holy Wruhecist kingdom could rise. I am at peace with that now."

Titus Gordion

"And now that I'm overseeing Wruhec's Guardians, that responsibility has been bestowed upon them as well."

Titus Gordion

He paused, as if deliberating whether to tell me something.

Player_Romus

"He's coming here now? I wish you'd informed me of this sooner."

Lucita Azaro

"I'm not sure if 'interesting' is the word I'd use..."

Player_Romus

"God dammit, Lucita... I was not prepared for an interrogation."

Lucita Azaro

“While we are waiting, though, there is a matter of concern that requires your attention."

Lucita Azaro

“Several municipalities have already been overrun, riots have broken out in the streets -- the people are demanding change."

Player_Romus

“Well, what would you call it?”

Player_Romus

“Lucita, you're blowing this out of proportion.”

Lucita Azaro

“Now, I've already made arrangements for myself in case this worst-case scenario becomes a reality.”

Narrator

Lucita respectfully bowed her head before leaving me to contemplate the weight of her words. Once again, I found myself alone in the silent expanse of the great hall.

Player_Romus

"A revolution... my God... never in a million years could I have imagined how dire the situation would become."

Player_Romus

"A revolution? Is that what we've come to?

Player_Romus

"And whose fault is that, Lucita? Surely you're not suggesting that I bear responsibility for this."

Player_Romus

"I'm not going anywhere. My place is here. I will face any challenge thrown my way head-on."

Player_Romus

"As much as it pains me to say it... yes, you may very well be right."

Player_Romus

"This is unbelievable... I pray that the Divine guided us through this turmoil."

Player_Romus

"What?! The people hate me? Sure you jest..."

Lucita Azaro

"We can discuss the how and why all we like, but it doesn't change the trajectory of where this is likely heading for..."

Narrator

Lucita placed a gentle kiss on my cheek before respectfully bowing her head and departing, leaving me to ponder the gravity of her words. Once more, I was left alone in the vast silence of the grand hall.

Lucita Azaro

"A revolution."

Lucita Azaro

"I'm sorry to be the bearer of such news, but we're seeing a turning point that we can no longer ignore.”

Lucita Azaro

"I'm not blaming anyone. I'm simply explaining the situation we find ourselves in."

Lucita Azaro

Your resilience is admirable, and I stand ready to support you through whatever lies ahead. Although, I must admit, the magnitude of the challenges we face is certainly concerning."

Lucita Azaro

Then I'll be right here by your side, my love. We'll face whatever comes together, no matter what."

Lucita Azaro

“Which is why we should begin making necessary arrangements for ourselves in case this worst-case scenario becomes a reality.”

Lucita Azaro

"Although, I do hope that if the situation becomes dire, you'll do what's necessary to ensure our safety."

Player_Romus

"This is unbelievable... Surely we'll find a way to get through this turmoil."

Lucita Azaro

"And we mustn't overlook the rampant religious violence that's been occurring, evidenced by interfaith conflicts erupting across various regions."

Lucita Azaro

"I'm receiving anonymous tips and warnings from informants within the court and from sources outside the kingdom who speak of growing discontent with how Rizia is being led."

Player_Romus

"Discontent? From within our very own court?"

Player_Romus

"Well, it sounds like someone's been reading too many spy thrillers. But in all seriousness, if there's even a hint of truth to these whispers, we must act swiftly."

Lucita Azaro

“I can assure you, this threat is very real. We’re seeing a turning point that we can no longer ignore.”

Lucita Azaro

"The nobles ruling these regions seem either unable to quell the unrest -- or unwilling."

Lucita Azaro

"Yes, sir. These sources hint at potential changes in leadership."

Lucita Azaro

"If there's nothing else you require of me, I'll take my leave and attend to other matters."

Narrator

I took a moment to let the gravity of the situation sink in.

Lucita Azaro

"The daily protests we've been seeing... they've undergone a significant escalation across the entire kingdom.”

Lucita Azaro

"Valenqiris appears to be experiencing destabilization as well."

Lucita Azaro

"I'm sure you've been keeping abreast of the violent protests in Valenqiris."

Player_Romus

"This is, indeed, troubling news. Continue to gather any and all information that you can. We must stay vigilant."

Narrator

I took a moment to allow for the weight of the situation to settle in -- the potential of my own house turning against me.

Lucita Azaro

"I highly doubt your cousin Rico would sit idly by if you were to take such action."

Lucita Azaro

"Not to mention, all evidence I've presented points to TItus, who must be brought to justice. Forgive me for being so blunt, but letting someone else take the fall for his actions would be criminal."

Player_Romus

"So, hypothetically speaking... if my uncle were to say... be found guilty of killing my father, would that ward off the potentially of an equally hypothetical coup?"

Narrator

It appeared as if the heavens above were turning against me.

Player_Romus

"No. I don't buy it. It must be some other Toras nobles stirring up trouble."

Lucita Azaro

"I know this isn't strictly my department anymore, but I've had my ear to the ground."

Lucita Azaro

"I have more bad news, by the way."

Lucita Azaro

"I know this isn't strictly my department anymore, but I've had my ear to the ground."

Lucita Azaro

"The nobles ruling that region seem either unable to quell the unrest -- or unwilling."

Potential House Coup

Potential House Coup

Player_Romus

"Is there any other bad news I need to hear about?"

Player_Romus

"Keep monitoring the situation."

Lucita Azaro

"You would need to portray him as having done something unforgivable..."

Player_Romus

"I obviously angered Hugo by extraditing his son. Could he be plotting something?"

Lucita Azaro

"If he does, it's a reluctant one. But there are some who rally around him as Rizia's rightful king."

Titus Gordion

"His Majesty Valero died nearly eight years ago. As I understand it, from natural causes."

Player_Romus

“Actually, Titus, I am their superior. The Golden Guard is sworn to protect me, even from guardsmen within.”

Titus Gordion

"According to her note, she informed me ahead of time ‘out of respect’ so I could make arrangements before she informs you -- a 'head start,' as she put it."

Narrator

The room fell into a tense silence as the accusations hung in the air.

Player_Romus

“Do you have anything to say on the matter, Lucita?”

Titus Gordion

“Simple. Lucita saw the report and planted the poison herself.”

Player_Romus

"Your protests fall on deaf ears, Titus. Your fate is sealed."

Player_Romus

"Well, that was undoubtedly one of the most unpleasant experiences I've had."

Player_Romus

"Oh, knock it off, will you?"

Player_Romus

"Yes, keep fighting. See how far that gets you."

Player_Romus

"Yes, I too thought it sounded a bit farfetched."

Player_Romus

"Anything else you can share with us, Titus, that would help absolve you of these accusations?"

Player_Romus

"I trust you, Lucita, and have no reason to believe otherwise. The only future for Titus is a future behind bars. Guards, arrest him now."

Titus Gordion

"Thank you, Your Majesty. Your support means everything."

Titus Gordion

"Calling it sabotage is putting it lightly. She probably planted the poison herself, which given the results of the toxicology report,  wouldn't have been difficult to acquire."

Player_Romus

"Lucita, can you explain why you felt the need to inform Titus in this manner?"

Player_Romus

"It's sad, Captain. To witness a respected officer resort to baseless accusations in a desperate attempt to deflect suspicion."

Lucita Azaro

"Because I felt it was my duty, as it pertained to his involvement in the investigation. Transparency is essential in such matters."

Titus Gordion

"They aren't baseless if they're true! Lucita's deceit knows no bounds."

Player_Romus

"Well, this is certainly not how I expected this day to go. If either of have anything you wish to add to the conversation before I make my decision, now is the time."

Player_Romus

"Come now, Titus. It's not like I'm sending you to the gallows -- not yet, at least."

Titus Gordion

"I understand your skepticism, Your Majesty. However, if I may, I implore you to consider the facts. Lucita's motives are clear, and the evidence speaks for itself. I have nothing to hide."

Titus Gordion

"Lucita's motives are abundantly clear, and the lack of evidence speaks volumes. I stand firm in my innocence and invite scrutiny of the truth."

Narrator

Exhaling deeply, I settled back onto my throne.

Narrator

Despite Titus's efforts to resist, they maintained a firm grip, pulling him forcefully out of the throne room.

Narrator

Titus fought against their forceful grip as they escorted him out of the throne room, but their hold was unyielding.

Narrator

Titus struggled against the guards, but their grip remained unwavering as they dragged him out of the throne room.

Lucita Azaro

"I know, right? Sometimes reality is stranger than fiction."

Lucita Azaro

"I, for one, certainly took no pleasure in informing you either."

Narrator

It was then that Titus burst through the doors past a couple of Wruhec's Guardians sentries, waving a letter.

Player_Romus

“Actually, Titus, I am their superior. The Wruhec's Guardians are sworn to protect me, even from guardsmen within.”

Player_Romus

"You are both overlooking one obvious suspect. Sal Ignacius."

Player_Romus

"You are wrong. Hugo Toras was the guilty party after all."

Titus Gordion

"I beg your pardon?"

Narrator

As the guards firmly grip her arms, Lucita struggles against their hold, her voice raised in protest.

Player_Romus

“I can, and I will. Your words are meaningless. Justice will be served.”

Player_Romus

The only mistake I made was marrying you."

Narrator

Lucita tried to resist their forceful guidance, but their grasp remains steadfast until she was dragged out of the throne room.

Narrator

Lucita flashed a vicious scowl as she was dragged out of the throne room.

Player_Romus

"Say that again, only this time, really mean it."

Final Decision

Final Decision

Titus Gordion

"That is not the only bad news, by the way."

Player_Romus

"Keep monitoring the situation."

Titus Gordion

"And as a man of faith myself, I would highly advise against it."

Titus Gordion

"I will."

Titus Gordion

"The same goes for Brenas and House Sazon..."

Narrator

It was then that the Golden Guard sentries opened the throne room doors and Lucita walked in. She looked confused.

Lucita Azaro

“What's this all about?”

Narrator

Titus instructed the sentries to stay behind while he, once again, detailed his findings concerning my father's death.

Player_Romus

“You’re saying this is all a lie?”

Lucita Azaro

“I wouldn’t be surprised if it turned out that he, in fact, had something to do with your father’s demise.”

Player_Romus

“Will you two be quiet? Explain then how the poison found in my father's bloodstream ended up in your residence?"

Player_Romus

"Duchess, so happy you could join us."

Player_Romus

"Ah, Lucita. We were just talking about you."

Player_Romus

"So is it true?"

Player_Romus

"Step inside, Lucita. There's something urgent we need to discuss right away."

Lucita Azaro

"Is what true? I have no idea why I'm here."

Titus Gordion

"Allow me to bring you up to speed."

Narrator

Lucita's eyes widened in disbelief as the weight of Titus's accusation settled upon her.

Player_Romus

"I'm afraid not. Care to explain yourself?"

Lucita Azaro

"Absolutely! That is... I had nothing to do with your father's death."

Player_Romus

"Oh, quit playing dumb. Just come out with it and admit to what you did."

Lucita Azaro

"This is ridiculous. I can't believe  you would accuse me of something like this!"

Lucita Azaro

"Hold your tongue! You're not the one I'm addressing."

Lucita Azaro

"Shut the hell up, Titus! I wasn't addressing you!"

Titus Gordion

"You would say that, wouldn't you. Though, it comes as no surprise, despite the mountain of evidence that says otherwise."

Lucita Azaro

"Okay, I'll admit that some of what Captain Gordion said was true. I was more keen on retaking Pales than I ever let on to you, Your Majesty."

Lucita Azaro

"But that doesn't make me a murderer! I only went to see your father so that I might plead with him to save mine -- convince him somehow to change his mind."

Player_Romus

"Regardless of whether or not she murdered my father, I will not tolerate you speak to my wife with such disrespect, you hear me?"

Player_Romus

"Stop yelling! You two are giving me a headache."

Player_Romus

"I agree with the Captain. You're only making this worse for yourself."

Player_Romus

"Regardless of whether or not she murdered my father, I will not tolerate you speak to someone of royal lineage with such disrespect, you hear me?"

Lucita Azaro

"Then you're blind! Titus is clearly trying to set me up."

Lucita Azaro

"Ask yourself... would it be so hard for someone to read the toxicology report, get ahold of said toxin, and plant in somewhere so that someone else is found guilty?"

Player_Romus

"She's right, Titus. Try to show some respect, even if she is guilty."

Player_Romus

"So happy you could join us, my dear."

Titus Gordion

"Eloquent as always, Lucita.  Your articulate rebuttals are truly awe-inspiring."

Narrator

It was then that the Wruhec's Guardian sentries opened the throne room doors and Lucita walked in. She looked confused.

Player_Romus

"If Lucita is found guilty of my father's murder, will that help quell unrest in her province?"

Titus Gordion

"For all we know, she could be orchestrating everything behind the scenes."

FINAL DECISION LUCITA NOT PRESENT

FINAL DECISION LUCITA NOT PRESENT

LUCITA WALKS IN

LUCITA WALKS IN

Potential House Coups

Potential House Coups

Lucita Azaro

"But that doesn't make me a murderer. And we did reconquer Pales, didn't we?"

Player_Romus

“Thank you, Titus. You've done a great service by bringing this to my attention. I never doubted your ability to get to the bottom of this.”

Titus Gordion

"I can't imagine how you must be feeling, given the nature of your relationship."

Player_Romus

"That's frankly none of your business."

Titus Gordion

"An unfortunate truth. But for me, knowing late is still preferable to never knowing."

Titus Gordion

"You're right. I didn't mean to overstep."

Player_Romus

"I'd be lying if I said I wasn't deeply hurt by this whole affair, but I've experienced grief before and will get through it again."

Player_Romus

"Well, that was hands-down one of the worst moments of my life."

Player_Romus

"My God... what the hell just happened?"

Narrator

Titus respectfully bowed his head before leaving me to contemplate the weight of his words. Once again, I found myself alone in the silent expanse of the great hall.

Titus Gordion

"With your permission, I will take my leave."

Player_Romus

"He has keys to every room in the palace. He could easily have planted the poison."

Player_Romus

"No questions. He's guilty. I know it."

Lucita Azaro

"I see..."

Lucita Azaro

"Shall I tell your new security team to arrest him?"

Narrator

With a salute, she walked out of the room.

Narrator

Titus respectfully bowed his head before leaving me to contemplate the weight of his words. Once again, I found myself alone in the silent expanse of the great hall.

Titus Gordion

"With your permission, I will take my leave."

Titus Gordion

"I see..."

Player_Romus

"With a heavy heart, I order you to do what needs to be done."

Player_Romus

"Absolutely. I can't wait to see the look on my dear uncle's face."

Player_Romus

"No. Just keep an eye on him."

Player_Romus

"He has lots of influence within the palace. He could easily have planted the poison."

Player_Romus

"The poison used in the murder causes hallucinations. Why not also divine visions? Perhaps he was trying to conduct some clandestine ritual with my father."

Player_Romus

"No questions. He's guilty. I know it."

Lucita Azaro

"I see..."

Lucita Azaro

"Shall I order his arrest?"

Player_Romus

"Absolutely. I can't wait to see the look on my dear uncle's face."

Lucita Azaro

"Shall I tell your new security team to arrest him?"

Player_Romus

"Absolutely. I can't wait to see the look on my dear uncle's face."

Player_Romus

"No. Just keep an eye on him."

Titus Gordion

"I see..."

Titus Gordion

"Shall I order his arrest?"

Player_Romus

"With a heavy heart, I order you to do what needs to be done."

Lucita Azaro

"I still think you are making a mistake by ignoring the evidence against Captain Gordion. But I shall do as you ask."

Titus Gordion

"I still think you are making a mistake by ignoring the evidence against Duchess Azaro. But I shall do as you ask."

Titus Gordion

"As for Duchess Azaro... shall I order her officially charged with the murder of King Valero?"

Player_Romus

"No. You are overlooking one obvious suspect. Sal Ignacius."

Narrator

He gaped at me.

Player_Romus

"I have made up my mind. Hugo Toras was the guilty party after all."

Narrator

He gaped at me.

Titus Gordion

"I beg your pardon?"

Titus Gordion

"I beg your pardon?"

Titus Gordion

"I still think you are making a mistake by ignoring the evidence against Duchess Azaro. But I shall do as you ask."

Player_Romus

"His activities the night of my father's death are still unaccounted for. And he could easily have planted the poison."

Player_Romus

"The poison used in the murder causes hallucinations. Why not also divine visions? Perhaps he was trying to conduct some clandestine ritual with my father."

Player_Romus

"No questions. He's guilty. I know it."

Player_Romus

"Absolutely. I can't wait to see the look on my dear uncle's face."

Titus Gordion

"I see..."

Player_Romus
